topic.title: Introduction
topic.shortdesc: The DITA-OT Gradle Plugin provides native Gradle integration for publishing DITA documentation using DITA Open Toolkit.

section.title: Overview
section.p: This modern Gradle plugin is a Kotlin-based continuation of the original com.github.eerohele.dita-ot-gradle plugin, offering enhanced features for CI/CD integration and automated documentation workflows.
For more information, visit the plugin GitHub repository or the official DITA Open Toolkit website.
To get started, see for installation instructions.

ul.li: Progress Reporting - Visual indicators during builds
Link Checking - Built-in task to validate internal and external links
Content Validation - DitaOtValidateTask for DITA validation without full transformation
Automated Downloads - DitaOtDownloadTask with retries, checksums, and caching
Plugin Installation - DitaOtInstallPluginTask supporting registry, URL, or local sources
Configuration Cache - Enables 77% faster incremental builds
Modern Architecture - Provider API and Gradle 9.0 compatibility

section.title: Use Cases
section.p: The plugin supports five primary workflows:

ol.li: Plugin Testing - Test existing registry plugins with different DITA-OT versions
Custom Plugin Development - Fast iteration cycles with automatic rebuilding
CI/CD Publishing - Reproducible documentation builds with GitHub Actions
Multi-Language Output - Parallel builds for localized documentation
Version-Specific Docs - Conditional processing for multiple product versions
